meanings.definition: A large citrus fruit similar to a grapefruit.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a juicy shaddock for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The shaddock was so refreshing on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent3: The shaddock rolled off the table and surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as bright and cheerful as a shaddock.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant color of the shaddock made it stand out in the fruit bowl.

meanings.sent1: The shaddock tree in our backyard provides shade in the afternoon.
meanings.sent2: We planted a new shaddock tree in the garden last spring.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels playfully chase each other around the shaddock tree.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the shaddock tree reached towards the sky like outstretched arms.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the blossoms on the shaddock tree filled the air with sweetness.
